name: East Bay Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: Our enjoyable visit to Jamestown was enhanced by the opportunity to stay several nights at East Bay Bed and Breakfast. From the delightful rooms to the wonderfully prepared breakfasts, our family truly enjoyed the hospitality of Greg and Donna. We hope to return for another visit, even though we won't have a wedding to attend as our excuse. Thanks.
reviews.title: Fantastic Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife Lisa and I stayed at the East Bay BnB for 3 nights, June 29th through July 2nd 2008. We stayed in the Bayside room which was wonderful. We took advantage of the all day pass on the Jamestown/Newport Ferry which we really enjoyed. The East Bay BnB was a short walk from the local restaurants and the dock of the ferry. The breakfasts at the BnB were great. Waffles one morning, Pancakes the next, and Egg cooked to order the last day. Fresh fruit was served with each as well as coffee, tea, and various juices. Donna and Greg made us feel very welcome. We are "cat people' and the BnB cat came to visit us a couple of time. We enjoyed his visits.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the East Bay Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frank Tomesch
reviews.title: The Delightful East Bay Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the East Bay Bed and Breakfast for the first time in June 2007 to attend our son's wedding to a wonderful young woman from Jamestown. Donna was away during our stay, but Greg made us feel welcomed and relaxed for the big event. The guest rooms in this beautiful Victorian home are a treat for the eyes and include every need for a enjoyable stay (from luxurious sheets on comfortable queen-sized beds, plush towels and robes to satellite TV with a DVD/CD player and access to movies and games from Donna and Greg's collection. They provide a variety of brochures with information regarding the sights and attractions of scenic Rhode Island. The setting for the East Bay B&B is on a quiet side street and within walking distance to the Atlantic, as well as local shops and restaurants. The homemade breakfast at East Bay is fresh and delicious. As cat owners, we were delighted to seek out and spend time with Luxor the cat.
reviews.title: We reserved the entire B&B for our wedding guests

reviews.text: We returned to East Bay B&B in April 2008 to attend another wedding in our "new family" and met Donna. Once again, we felt the instant warmth that greeted us as soon as we reached the front door. We had an unplanned visit to the Newport Hospital and the concern shown by both Donna and Greg was heartwarming. They offered us the opportunity to spend another night with them (at no cost ) before we traveled back to our home. Priceless!
reviews.title: Low-Key Luxury

likes.disliked: — Wireless Internet signal was a little weak in our room.

reviews.text: My stay at East Bay B&B was (unfortunately) only an overnight -- I was very happy with the experience and would have been glad to stay longer if my plans allowed.
reviews.title: Warm, comfortable B&B with quality amenities

reviews.text: My room was very comfortable and equipped with especially nice amenities: recently-remodeled 'period style' bath, soap/shampoo, piles of towels, bathrobes, TV & DVD, clock radio, small fridge and an excellent mattress with high-threadcount linens.
reviews.title: My first bnb of my trip

likes.disliked: — no atmosphere in the common areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: East Bay is, as the picture shows, a true B&B, converted from a single family house. My room was plenty large by that standard (larger than my own bedroom in a similar age house) and had nice, not glossy, decor -- attractive antique/near-antique furniture and quirky artwork. On the warm July night I was there I found it very thougtful that they equipped my room with a fan so I could take advantage of the cool evening breezes as an alternative to the A/C.
reviews.title: "Great stay plus a friendly cat"

likes.disliked: — Bed too soft for my liking but not horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Donna and Greg are friendly, genuiine people who obviously care about their guests. They showed this with their welcome and their atttention to the extra-nice details.
reviews.title: Wonderful eperience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is really convenient -- just a short block up a side street from Jamestown's dock/marina area where you can catch the ferry to Newport in the warmer months and (literally) a few steps farther around the next corner to Jamestown's small, bustling and quaint street of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: great location in Jamestown

likes.disliked: — lack of chairs, small tv, hot breakfast room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the place, but RI is very expensive from our perspective.
reviews.title: Best B&B in RI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: M
reviews.title: A Great Introduction to the Hospitality in Jamestown

likes.disliked: — There was one flight of stairs to the bedrooms. I find stairs painful to climb, but it was not a reason not to stay there. However, anyone with real disabilities would find it a reason to find some other place.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the East Bay Bed & Breakfast over the first few days in July. Our daughter and her husband were moving to Jamestown, and the furniture for the rented house had not arrived. Our hosts made us very welcome. The room was large, the bed very comfortable, and the shower in the bathroom had a little ledge which was wide enough to be a seat for me to sit on while I had my shower. Since I am not good at standing unsupported this was a great bonus for me. The breakfasts were lovely. Since we were there for about 4 or 5 nights the breakfasts were varied so that we were not served the same one each day. We would recommend this B&B to anyone wanting to stay in Jamestown.
reviews.title: East Bay B&B is a Gem!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful 3-day stay at the B&B in August, during the Newport Jazz Fest. We enjoyed the quiet beauty of Jamestown, which was just a short 5-minute car ride across the bridge to Newport. The hosts are very friendly and helpful, and they make a delicious breakfast each morning. And the rooms are all large and charming, furnished with Victorian antiques, but with modern bathrooms. We highly recommend this lovely inn!
reviews.title: Quiet B&B so near Newport

reviews.text: We loved staying in and Jamestown, away from the busy Newport downtown. East Bay B&B is a perfect location, walk to restaurants and the waterfront in minutes. Greg and Donna gave great suggestions for restaurants, tours and more. Breakfasts were delicious and plenty of food. Our room was very homey and private. Try it, you'll like it!
reviews.title: East Bay or Bust

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The East Bay Bed and Breakfast is a small and cozy four room inn in downtown Jamestown. Everything is within walking distance, including the Newport ferry. Donna and Greg have a beautiful home and provide a wonderful breakfast. We stayed in the smallest room, East Ferry, however it was a good size with a comfortable bed and was completely spotless. The inn also runs Internet specials for weekday nights, which makes it very affordable. I highly recommend this inn.
reviews.title: A quaint little inn

reviews.text: Very nice B & B just minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Newport which was perfect for us. Definitely a casual home w/ two cats and a youngster about but this actually contributed to the relaxed feel of the place. Rooms were very clean and nice size. Nice touches all around and the breakfasts were great, especially the baked goods. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Really Nice Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a true B&B experience! Donna and Greg as well as their cat Luxor were great hosts - laid back and hospitable. Desirable location on a back street one block from the main commercial area (granted small) with stores and restaurants. It seemed like our room, the Narangansett, had a newly renovated bathroom. We were provided with lots of fluffy white towels. Hot, homemade breakfast was served in the main dining room of the house. We highly recommend this place! Note though Jamestown is separated from Newport by the Newport (Pell) Bridge, which has a toll of $2 each way.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B!
Wonderful!!
reviews.text: Our rooms were clean and cozy, the house is old but restored with all the comforts. We loved the hommade breakfast and the Kohler family treated us like gold. This is one of the best B&B's I've stayed in.

We stayed at the East Bay over the July Fourth holiday weekend, while attending a family reunion in Jamestown. The room was beautifully furnished and well equipped, and we came to see it as a respite from our family's many activities. The owners were enormously welcoming without being invasive or hovering, and breakfast was a real treat.
reviews.title: A peaceful haven

description: Victorian - style inn offering 4 guest rooms, each graciously appointed with period furnishings, and all the comforts and conveniences of home. Located in the heart of Jamestown, RI, this b&b is 3 houses from the water and around the corner from restaurants and shops. Spend the day strolling through this quaint, coastal village or enjoy a trip across the harbor to Newport aboard a seasonal ferry. Or, Newport is 10 minutes by car.
